nodes.bodyText:
This runs in a separate thread, but seems quite expensive with the string concat and the MetricsMetaData allocation each time we send the metric.
Does it make sense to initialize the MetaData with the different name suffixes in the constructor?
Yes, we should do this only once in the constructor; it's a waste of resources to do this every time.
I understand you changed this for the tests, but it's a bit ugly. Maybe add a comment?
Strictly speaking this mapper is only necessary for having deterministic test results. The proper solution would probably be parsing the JSON response and compare the results not as a string.
Yeah I wasn't too happy with it either; it is especially finicky since every setting the reporter uses for the mapper is ignored by the test :/
